definition: lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to neglect/to skip (class or work)/to waste (time)/vast/loose-fitting

sentences.english: Oily skin after bathing, every mind and the body fluent in its landscaping.
sentences.chinese: 洗浴后皮肤油腻，浑身舒畅，气血通顺，心旷神怡。

sentences.english: The music of this song sent her carefree and joyous.
sentences.chinese: 这支歌的乐曲使她心旷神怡。

sentences.english: The euphonious sound of Carrie's cello playing always puts me at ease.
sentences.chinese: 嘉莉悦耳的大提琴演奏总让我心旷神怡。

sentences.english: Watching the distant views from this high point makes me completely relaxed and joyful.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得到这里登高望远真是心旷神怡。

sentences.english: A brisk walk in cool weather is invigorating.
sentences.chinese: 在凉爽的天气里轻松地散步令人心旷神怡。

sentences.english: The fresh air and the lare green in my school makes us relaxed and happy.
sentences.chinese: 学校有着新鲜的空气，大片的绿化，使人心旷神怡。

sentences.english: What can be better than a nice cup of coffee in the very beginning of a day?
sentences.chinese: 还有什么比清早的一杯咖啡更让人心旷神怡？

sentences.english: In spring abundant environment, I feel relaxed and happy.
sentences.chinese: 处在春季盎然的环境中，我倍感心旷神怡。

sentences.english: The beauty of the sunrise is really breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 日出的美景真令人心旷神怡。

sentences.english: Imagine you're surrounded by the beautiful forest in the painting on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 墙壁上美轮美奂的画让您仿佛置身于丛林，心旷神怡。

sentences.english: The flowers in the garden give out pleasant smell.
sentences.chinese: 花园里的花香味扑鼻令人心旷神怡。

sentences.english: I found Yuelu to be absolutely stunning, and the view from the top of the mountain at night was breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 特别是岳麓山，站在山顶看风景，让人心旷神怡。

definition: to penetrate deeply into the heart (idiom)/to gladden the heart/to refresh the mind
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
water and sky merge in one color (idiom)
lit. birdsong and fragrant flowers (idiom); fig. the intoxication of a beautiful spring day
